p: Some scholars have focused on youth’ involvement and participation in UN processes, including the UNFCCC COPs.12 Overall, the literature is very positive about the actions led by young people, claiming that they have indeed helped push for more ambitious climate action.13 However, some scholars argue that young people have become a disruptive power—rather than constructive agents—in climate change policymaking.14 Their use of the rhetoric of generational conflict, in which adult leaders are portrayed as blameworthy and irresponsible, has created polarization. Others have specifically examined climate change from a children’s rights perspective and how this has been leveraged in litigation.15 Despite this work, there has been little examination of young people’s efforts through the lens of an HRBA and its operational principles.
